subclassFeature.name: Frostglider
entries: The frozen wilderness is harsh territory that challenges even the strongest explorers. But this challenge fosters strength and skill, especially when you learn to weaponise it. You use the climate and beasts of winter to your advantage, riding sleds across the land and stalking targets from the fog. While your talents are effective in any terrain, they make you a brutal force of nature in the lands of ice and snow.

subclassFeature.name: Frostglider Magic
entries: At 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell leomund's tiny hut} spell as a ritual. When you cast the spell, the hut takes the outside appearance of an igloo or a domed stick hut (your choice) but remains transparent from the inside.

You also learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Frostglider Spells table. Each spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Arctic Acclimation
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you have adapted to life in the coldest parts of the wilderness, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to cold damage.
You automatically pass saving throws against falling prone on slippery ice.
Being in an area that is lightly obscured by heavy precipitation, such as rain, snowfall or fog, does not impose disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks you make.
You can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of furs, pelts or blubber to produce a set of warm clothes that allow the wearer to automatically succeed on saving throws against extreme cold.

subclassFeature.name: Mushing Sled
entries: Starting at 3rd level, over the course of one minute, you can summon a sled pulled by squad of mushing beasts. The sled weighs 50 lbs, can be up to 15 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and may feature foot boards, seats and cargo beds. While typically designed for travel over ice or snow, it can traverse any solid terrain that the beasts can pull it across.

The beasts have a number and appearance of your choice, but collectively use the {@creature mushing beasts|J:Frost} statblock. They share your initiative and will obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you), but they will refuse to be more than 20 feet from the sled. If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. The beasts and the sled disappear at the end of your next short or long rest, or if the beasts are reduced to 0 hit points.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 1st-Level or higher to resummon it.

subclassFeature.name: All-Terrain Mushing
entries: Starting at 7th level, your mushing beasts gain a climbing and swimming speed equal to their walking speed. In addition, they can ignore nonmagical difficult terrain. The sled is capable of floating on water or being dragged up and over rough terrain without impeding the beasts movement.

subclassFeature.name: Snow Prowler
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can find your prey in even the thickest storms, seeing them before they see you. You and your mushing beasts have blindsight out to 10 feet.

Additionally, when a creature you can see has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks due to heavy precipitation, such as rain, snowfall or fog, you and your mushing beasts have advantage on attack rolls against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Frostbiter
entries: Starting at 11th level, you are fuelled by the fatal power of winter. When you deal damage to a creature with a ranger spell, or your mushing beasts deal damage to a creature, you can change the damage type to cold. This damage ignores resistance to cold damage.
Additionally, cold damage cannot break your concentration on ranger spells.

subclassFeature.name: Freeze Assault
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you take damage, you can use a reaction to change the damage type to cold damage. If the damage was part of an attack, the attacker has disadvantage on further attack rolls against you until the end of the current turn.

trait.name: Beasts of Burden
entries: When dragging the sled, the beasts can pull 200xPB lbs., including the sled itself.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a small beast.

trait.name: Through Wind and Rain
entries: Being in an area that is lightly obscured by heavy precipitation, such as rain, snowfall or fog, does not impose disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks the beasts make.
In addition, when you cast {@spell Hunter's Mark|XPHB} on a creature, the beasts also benefit from the spell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4+PB|+4 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target, {@h} {@damage 1d8+4+PB|1d8+4 plus PB} piercing damage.
